name: Form.Input

aliases.name: Input
aliases.comment:
An input renders Html from a field state and list of additional attributes.
All input functions using this type alias are pre-wired with event handlers.
aliases.type: Form.FieldState e a -> List (Html.Attribute Form.Msg) -> Html.Html Form.Msg

values.name: baseInput
values.comment: Untyped input, first param is `type` attribute.

values.name: checkboxInput
values.comment: Checkbox input.

values.name: dumpErrors
values.comment: Dump all form errors in a `<pre>` tag. Useful for debugging.

values.name: passwordInput
values.comment: Password input.

values.name: radioInput
values.comment: Radio input.

values.name: selectInput
values.comment: Select input.
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Form.Input.Input e String

values.name: textArea
values.comment: Textarea.

values.name: textInput
values.comment: Text input.

name: Form

aliases.name: FieldState
aliases.comment:
Field state containing all necessary data for view and update,
can be retrived with `Form.getFieldAsString` or `Form.getFieldAsBool`.

 * `path` - qualified path of the field in the form, with dots for nested fields (`field.subfield`)
 * `value` - a `Maybe` of the requested type
 * `error` - a `Maybe` of the field error
 * `liveError` - same but with added logic for live validation
    (see [`getLiveErrorAt`](https://github.com/etaque/elm-simple-form/blob/master/src/Form.elm) impl)
 * `isDirty` - if the field content has been changed since last validation
 * `isChanged` - if the field value has changed since last init/reset
 * `hasFocus` - if the field is currently focused
aliases.type: { path : String , value : Maybe.Maybe a , error : Maybe.Maybe (Form.Error.Error e) , liveError : Maybe.Maybe (Form.Error.Error e) , isDirty : Bool , isChanged : Bool , hasFocus : Bool }

types.name: Form
types.comment:
Form to embed in your model. Type parameters are:

 * `customError` - a custom error type to extend built-in errors (set to `()` if you don't need it)
 * `output` - the type of the validation output.

values.name: getChangedFields
values.comment: Get set of changed fields.

values.name: getErrors
values.comment: Get list of errors on qualified paths.
values.type: Form.Form e o -> List ( String, Form.Error.Error e )

values.name: getFieldAsBool
values.comment: Get field state at path, with value as a `Bool`.
values.type: String -> Form.Form e o -> Form.FieldState e Bool

values.name: getFieldAsString
values.comment: Get field state at path, with value as a `String`.
values.type: String -> Form.Form e o -> Form.FieldState e String

values.name: getFocus
values.comment: Return currently focused field, if any.

values.name: getOutput
values.comment: Get form output, in case of validation success.

values.name: initial
values.comment: Initial form state. See `Form.Field` for initial fields, and `Form.Validate` for validation.
values.type: List ( String, Form.Field.Field ) -> Form.Validate.Validation e output -> Form.Form e output

values.name: isSubmitted
values.comment: Get form submission state. Useful to show errors on unchanged fields.

values.name: update
values.comment: Update form state with the given message
values.type: Form.Msg -> Form.Form e output -> Form.Form e output

name: Form.Validate

aliases.name: Validation
aliases.comment:
A validation is a function that takes a form field and returns a result
being either a validation error or the expected object.

values.name: andThen
values.comment:
Apply a new validation to the result of the validation.

    get "myfield" (int `andThen` minInt 10)
values.type: Form.Validate.Validation e a -> (a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b) -> Form.Validate.Validation e b

values.name: apply
values.comment:
Incremental form validation for records with more that 8 fields.

    Form.succeed SomeRecord
      `apply` (get "foo" string)
      `apply` (get "bar" string)
values.type: Form.Validate.Validation e (a -> b) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b

values.name: bool
values.comment: Validation a Bool.

values.name: customError
values.comment: Helper to create a CustomError.

values.name: customValidation
values.comment: Custom validation for your special cases.
values.type: Form.Validate.Validation e a -> (a -> Result.Result (Form.Error.Error e) b) -> Form.Validate.Validation e b

values.name: date
values.comment: Validation a Date using `Date.fromString`.

values.name: defaultValue
values.comment: Rescue a failed validation with the supplied value.
values.type: a -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e a

values.name: email
values.comment: Check if the string is a valid email address.

values.name: emptyString
values.comment:
Validate an empty string, otherwise failing with InvalidString.
Useful with `oneOf` for optional fields with format validation.

values.name: fail
values.comment: A validation that always fails. Useful for contextual validation.

values.name: float
values.comment: Validation a float using `String.toFloat`.

values.name: form1
values.comment: Validation a form with one field.
values.type: (a -> field) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e field

values.name: form2
values.comment: Validation a form with two fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b -> Form.Validate.Validation e m

values.name: form3
values.comment: Validation a form with three fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b -> Form.Validate.Validation e c -> Form.Validate.Validation e m

values.name: form4
values.comment: Validation a form with four fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b -> Form.Validate.Validation e c -> Form.Validate.Validation e d -> Form.Validate.Validation e m

values.name: form5
values.comment: Validation a form with five fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation err a -> Form.Validate.Validation err b -> Form.Validate.Validation err c -> Form.Validate.Validation err d -> Form.Validate.Validation err e -> Form.Validate.Validation err m

values.name: form6
values.comment: Validation a form with six fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> f -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation err a -> Form.Validate.Validation err b -> Form.Validate.Validation err c -> Form.Validate.Validation err d -> Form.Validate.Validation err e -> Form.Validate.Validation err f -> Form.Validate.Validation err m

values.name: form7
values.comment: Validation a form with seven fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> f -> g -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation err a -> Form.Validate.Validation err b -> Form.Validate.Validation err c -> Form.Validate.Validation err d -> Form.Validate.Validation err e -> Form.Validate.Validation err f -> Form.Validate.Validation err g -> Form.Validate.Validation err m

values.name: form8
values.comment: Validation a form with eight fields.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> f -> g -> h -> m) -> Form.Validate.Validation err a -> Form.Validate.Validation err b -> Form.Validate.Validation err c -> Form.Validate.Validation err d -> Form.Validate.Validation err e -> Form.Validate.Validation err f -> Form.Validate.Validation err g -> Form.Validate.Validation err h -> Form.Validate.Validation err m

values.name: format
values.comment: Validates format of the string.

values.name: formatError
values.comment: Call Result.formatError on validation result.
values.type: (Form.Error.Error e1 -> Form.Error.Error e2) -> Form.Validate.Validation e1 a -> Form.Validate.Validation e2 a

values.name: get
values.comment:
Access the given field in the group.

    get "name" string
values.type: String -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e a

values.name: includedIn
values.comment: Check if the string is included in the given list.
values.type: List String -> String -> Form.Validate.Validation e String

values.name: int
values.comment: Validation an integer using `String.toInt`.

values.name: map
values.comment:
Map over the result of the validation.

    get "myfield" (string |> map String.trim)
values.type: (a -> b) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b

values.name: maxFloat
values.comment: Max value for Float.

values.name: maxInt
values.comment: Max value for Int.

values.name: maxLength
values.comment: Max length for String.

values.name: maybe
values.comment: Transform validation result to `Maybe`, using `Result.toMaybe`.
values.type: Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e (Maybe.Maybe a)

values.name: minFloat
values.comment: Min value for Float.

values.name: minInt
values.comment: Min value for Int.

values.name: minLength
values.comment: Min length for String.

values.name: nonEmpty
values.comment: Fails if `String.isEmpty`.

values.name: oneOf
values.comment: First successful validation wins, from left to right.
values.type: List (Form.Validate.Validation e a) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a

values.name: pipeTo
values.comment:
Same as `andThen`, but flipped for piping.

    int |> pipeTo (minInt 10)
values.type: (a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b) -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation e b

values.name: string
values.comment: Validation a String.

values.name: succeed
values.comment: A validation that always succeeds. Useful for contextual validation.

values.name: url
values.comment: Check if the string is a valid URL.

values.name: withCustomError
values.comment:
Arrange that if a validation fails, it has the given custom error.

    get "customerId" (V.int
          `andThen` minInt 1
          `andThen` maxInt 9999
          |> withCustomError InvalidIdentity)
values.type: customErr -> Form.Validate.Validation e a -> Form.Validate.Validation customErr a

types.name: Error
types.comment: A validation error. See `Form.Validate.customError` for `CustomError` building.

values.name: getAt
values.comment: Get error at name, for nested errors.

name: Form.Field

types.name: Field
types.comment: Form field. Can either be a group of named fields, or a final field.

values.name: asBool
values.comment: Get field value as boolean.

values.name: asString
values.comment: Get field value as string.

values.name: at
values.comment: Get field at name, for nested forms.

values.name: group
values.comment: Build a group of values, for nested forms.
